physical_examinations.vital_signs: Calcium: 1.53 mmol/liter (RR 2.2–2.7), Phosphate: 1.9 mmol/liter (RR 1.1–1.8), PTH: undetectable
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Complaining of pain on walking, waddling gait, marked genu valgum, intermalleolar distance 9 cm. Skeletal survey showed metaphyseal changes in all long bones, including irregular, flared, radioopaque regions subjacent to growth plates.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The extent of radioopaque bands in lower limbs progressed from previous x-rays taken at 7.2 yr.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Intermalleolar distance 17 cm and mild bilateral knee contractures. She experienced severe linear growth failure.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Continued clinical and radiological progression of skeletal pathology.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Left femoral osteotomy performed with repeat bone biopsy.
Improvement noted in radiological appearance of metaphyses. Growth improvement was also observed.
Bilateral femoral screws were placed to stabilize knee joints.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Continued regression of metaphyseal abnormalities noted.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Estradiol: 76 pmol/liter, LH: 28.6 mIU/ml, FSH: 87.2 mIU/ml
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Bone age was 2-3 years delayed and previously had keratitis-uveitis that remitted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Noticeable regression of opacities in x-rays taken.
